abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Business Environment
            Reform and Institutional Strengthening Project for Macedonia
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; the
            risk to development outcome was moderate; the Bank's
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and the
            Borrower's performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: even a late
            restructuring could significantly improve implementation.
            When implementation is unacceptably slow, the team should
            raise the issue to the highest possible level as soon as
            possible, draw proper options and proceed. Having dedicated
            staff in implementing agencies is crucial for the success of
            the project. Pay detailed attention to the readiness of
            implementing agencies to carry out their duties at
            preparatory stage, particularly their capacity and staffing
            needs for project management, financial management and
            procurement. Project costing should be paid detailed
            attention at the preparatory stage.
